_meanings:
[{#ardati, Anarda, ArdIt#}, 
{#ardituM, ardita#} or {#arRa#}] 
{@--1@} To afflict, 
torment; strike, hurt, kill; {#rakzaHsahasrARi#}
{#caturdaSArdIt#} <ls>Bk. 12. 56</ls>, see {%<ab>caus.</ab>%} below.
{@--2@} To beg, request, ask;  
{#nirgalitAMbugarBaM SaradGanaM nArdati cAtakopi#} <ls>R. 5. 17.</ls>
{@--3@} To go. 
{@--4@} To move, be agitated
or moved; be scattered (as dust);
fly in pieces, dissolve (<ab>Ved.</ab>). (The
past participle is usually {#ardita#}, but
{#arRa#} when the root is preceded by
{#aBi, ni, vi, saM#}; <ab>cf.</ab> <ls>P. VII. 2. 24-5</ls>).

{@--2@} To stir
up, rouse, agitate, shake 
vehemently, make agitated or restless.

to 
overwork, to work or exert oneself 
beyond measure; to cause to flow away.

to oppress or press hard in 

return, assail in return, return an
attack.

<ab>Ved.</ab> to go or move
away; to oppress, harass, pain.
({%--<ab>caus.</ab>%}) to cause to be scattered
or dissolved, destroy, annihilate.
